revised_title: Effects of Heat Exposure on Rat Testes: Cytological and Histochemical Observations
tldr: The study examines the effects of heat exposure on rat testes, focusing on the development of germ cells and the function of Sertoli cells. Different exposure times to heat were tested, revealing critical periods of damage to germ cells and changes in the lipid content of Sertoli cells. The research also investigates the role of follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) in recovery and the functional activity of Leydig cells.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Reproductive Biology
